summary:
The dark web is a hidden part of the internet that requires special software to access. It allows people to browse and communicate anonymously, keeping their locations and identities secret. It is different from the regular internet, which is called Clearnet.

Dark web networks, like Tor, Freenet, and I2P, enable users to share information privately. These networks are often used for various purposes, including secure communication and accessing uncensored content. The dark web is a small part of the larger deep web, which includes all web content that search engines cannot find.
title: Dark web
